Every engineer officer in charge of a watch in a manned engine-room or designated duty engineer officer in a periodically unmanned engine-room on a seagoing ship powered by main propulsion machinery of ( ) propulsion power or more shall hold a certificate of competency.
A lifejacket shall have buoyancy which is not reduced by more than 5% after ( ) hours submersion in fresh water.

( ) means the Government of the State under whose authority the ship is operating. With respect to a ship entitled to fly a flag of a State, the ( ) is the Government of that State according to International Convention on the control of harmful anti-fouling systems on ship.
According to the SOLAS Convention as amended, a passenger ship is a ship which carries more than ( A ) passengers and a ( B ) ship is any ship which is not a passenger ship.
If there are ( ) grounds to believe that the ship is in violation of this Convention, a through inspection may be carried out taking into account guidelines developed by the Organization.

Under the STCW Convention as amended, each Administration shall require every company to ensure that the ship's complement can effectively co-ordinate their activities in an emergency situation and in performing functions vital to ( A ) or to the prevention or mitigation of ( B ).
Under the MARPOL Convention as amended, the discharge into the sea of oil or oily mixture necessary for the purpose of securing the ( A ) of a ship or ( B ) life at sea is excepted.

In accordance with the SOLAS Convention as amended, ( ) means the level for which further specific protective security measures shall be maintained for a limited period of time when a security incident is probable or imminent, although it may not be possible to identify the specific target.
In accordance with the SOLAS Convention as amended, every steam boiler shall be provided with not less than two ( ) valves of adequate capacity.
